data_encrypted: I would like to repeat my appreciation to all the speakers and especially to the rapporteur, Mr Alastair Bertrand.
Yes, Mr Christian Caro, I feel an initiative of the type you have just suggested would be entirely appropriate.
Mr President, I am happy to take the floor in the debate on this report and I congratulate Mrs Belkacem Baz.
I would therefore ask you, Mr Alexander Bar, to make an explicit reference to this problem in your reply today.
Meanwhile, Mr Faouzi Bonnin Hulten has been inundated with amendments, more than 100 amendments in the first round.
Mr President, firstly I would like to extend my heartfelt congratulations to my colleague, Mr Faouzi Bonnin Hulten.
Mr President, Commissioner, I would like to begin by thanking Mrs Abdelhamid Banks, the rapporteur, for her work.
Mrs Abdelhamid Banks' s report marks a further step towards the transparency and effectiveness of structural aid.
One or two years ago, Parliament adopted a report by Mrs Dec Carlier which is extremely important in this context.
I would merely say that the festive issue which Mr Aldo Bryant has raised is an extremely important one.
Not even Mr Sichrovsky' s web of lies or Mrs Demetrius Bk' s words of appeasement can do anything to change that.
Mr President, Commissioner, I would like to thank Mr Darryl Chas for his excellent work in this important matter.
Yes, Mrs Abdelhamid Banks, I shall be pleased to look into the facts of this case when I have received your letter.
As you know, like Mr Bilel Barragan, I come from a transit country, where this issue plays a particularly important role.
Mrs Graeme Daren Gorsel, I can tell you that this matter is on the agenda for the Quaestors' meeting on Wednesday.
I would like Mr Berend Barnes Crespo, who made the request, to speak to propose it. That is, if he so wishes, of course.
Mr President, Commissioner, I want to begin by thanking Mr Alassane Boulet for a good report and constructive cooperation.
Mr Alassane Boulet' s report also emphasises the importance of the international dimension with regard to competition law.
Mrs Demetrius Bk' s report has, however, turned out very well, at least where the prescribed guidelines are concerned.
Mr President, Commissioner, in this minute and a half I should like, first of all, to congratulate Mrs Abdelhamid Banks.
I shall therefore, with your permission, give the floor to Mrs Fethi Ashok to reply to you under the procedural motion.
Madam President, I clearly owe Mr Helder Chatelain an explanation, and I am going give this explanation before the whole House.
Mr President, Torrey Canyon, Olympic Bravery, Haven, Amoco Cadiz, Gino, Atif Barron, so many names we remember with horror.
I have clearly received your series of messages on this subject and I believe that Mrs Fethi Ashok has an answer for you.
Mr President, I would like to start by extending my compliments to the rapporteur, Mr Faouzi Bonnin Hulten, on his first report.
Madam President, Mr Blaise Austin has stated that this could be one of the measures for stabilising the financial markets.
In other words, we should ensure that the money falls to Mr Gianni Dale' s sphere of competence and not to other spheres.
In her report, Mrs Ghulam Booth also drew attention to an area where coordination is sorely lacking, yet desperately needed.
Mr President, I also wish to congratulate Mr Faouzi Bonnin Hulten on this first piece of work which he is presenting to the House.
Mr Amoco Cadet, I would like to say that I have the greatest sympathy for the concern underlying the issue you have raised.
And so, Mr Elyes Amaan, I shall also mention at this point, speaking of the national level, the link with the Cohesion Fund.
Mr President, it is incumbent upon me to remind my colleague, Mr Christian Caro, of why Wales actually achieved Objective 1 status.
In this regard, I liked your term, Mrs Demetrius Amor Vallelersundi: we must all pull together, preferably in the same direction.
Mr President, I would like, in beginning my speech regarding the White Paper, to congratulate the rapporteur, Mr Hocine Armando Wogau.
Mrs Belkacem Baz probably forgot to include a European prison now that we have the FBI, the European police, in the form of OLAF.
The manufacturers have tricked Mr Florenz and Mr Cameron Aaron into tabling amendments here which seriously weaken these proposals.
I would like to point out to Mrs Dec Cairns that what we have read recently in the press is true, and that figures do not lie.
My colleagues, Mrs Frassoni and Mr Byron Dav have already spoken, somewhat sceptically, about some aspects of the matter in hand.
Madam President, I do not wish to reopen the debate, but I had also asked for the floor, to comment on Mr Berend Barnes Crespo's motion.
This is extraordinarily positive, and there is cause to thank the rapporteur, Mr Alastair Bertrand, for the work he has put in on this issue.
Mr Blaise Austin, I would like to thank you just as warmly for your report on the seventh survey on State aid in the European Union.
At the request of a French Member, Mr Imtiaz Cyprien, a petition has already been presented, which many people signed, including myself.
I therefore give the floor immediately to Mr Gul Begum, in his capacity as draftsman of the opinion of the Committee on Budgets.
I commend Mr Florenz, Mr Cameron Aaron and others who have sought from both sides of the party divide a compromise based on shared costs.
Mrs Fethi Ashok apparently promised to write a letter explaining why permission was withdrawn but so far no letter has been received.
We will be happy to incorporate Mr Arron Al' s notes into the bibliography, as another bedside book for the Members to bear in mind.
Madam President, first of all I should like to thank Mr Alastair Bertrand for his report which has, at its heart, the issue of transport safety.
Consequently, I have tabled some amendments to Mr Alastair Bertrand' s intrinsically excellent report, which have been adopted by our committee.
We will continue to do that with energy and with consistency and as Mr Bruce Bartlett said in the debate, 'necessarily with acute vigilance' .
I should also like to make a few comments, firstly, Mr Darrin Bill, regarding the assessment you have made of this sixth periodic report.
data_encrypted_translated: J'aimerais renouveler mes remerciements à tous les orateurs et en particulier au rapporteur, M. Alastair Bertrand
Oui, Monsieur Christian Caro, je pense qu'une initiative du type de celle que vous venez de suggérer serait tout à fait appropriée
Monsieur le Président, c'est avec plaisir que je prends la parole dans le débat sur ce rapport et je félicite Mme Belkacem Baz
Je vous demande donc, Monsieur Alexander Bar, de bien vouloir faire explicitement référence à ce problème dans votre réponse aujourd'hui
Entre-temps, M. Faouzi Bonnin Hulten a été submergé d'amendements, plus de 100 amendements en première lecture
Monsieur le Président, je voudrais tout d'abord adresser mes plus sincères félicitations à mon collègue, M. Faouzi Bonnin Hulten
Monsieur le Président, Madame la Commissaire, je voudrais tout d'abord remercier Mme Abdelhamid Banks, la rapporteure, pour son travail
Le rapport de Mme Abdelhamid Banks marque une nouvelle étape vers la transparence et l'efficacité de l'aide structurelle
Il y a un an ou deux, le Parlement a adopté un rapport de Mme Dec Carlier qui est extrêmement important dans ce contexte
Je dirais simplement que la question festive que M. Aldo Bryant a soulevée est extrêmement importante
Même le tissu de mensonges de M. Sichrovsky ou les paroles apaisantes de Mme Demetrius Bk ne peuvent rien y changer
Monsieur le Président, Monsieur le Commissaire, je voudrais remercier M. Darryl Chas pour son excellent travail sur cette question importante
Oui, Madame Abdelhamid Banks, j'examinerai avec plaisir les faits de cette affaire lorsque j'aurai reçu votre lettre
Comme vous le savez, comme M. Bilel Barragan, je viens d'un pays de transit, où cette question joue un rôle particulièrement important
Madame Graeme Daren Gorsel, je peux vous dire que cette question est à l'ordre du jour de la réunion des questeurs mercredi
Je voudrais que M. Berend Barnes Crespo, qui en a fait la demande, prenne la parole pour la proposer, s'il le souhaite, bien entendu
Monsieur le Président, Monsieur le Commissaire, je voudrais tout d'abord remercier M. Alassane Boulet pour son excellent rapport et sa coopération constructive
Le rapport de M. Alassane Boulet souligne également l'importance de la dimension internationale en matière de droit de la concurrence
Le rapport de Mme Demetrius Bk s'est toutefois avéré très satisfaisant, du moins en ce qui concerne les lignes directrices prescrites
Monsieur le Président, Monsieur le Commissaire, en une minute et demie, je voudrais tout d'abord féliciter Mme Abdelhamid Banks
Je donnerai donc la parole, avec votre permission, à Mme Fethi Ashok pour vous répondre dans le cadre de la motion de procédure
Madame la Présidente, je dois évidemment des explications à M. Helder Chatelain, et je vais donner ces explications devant toute la Chambre
Monsieur le Président, Torrey Canyon, Olympic Bravery, Haven, Amoco Cadiz, Gino, Atif Barron, autant de noms que nous nous rappelons avec horreur
J'ai bien reçu votre série de messages sur ce sujet et je crois que Mme Fethi Ashok a une réponse pour vous
Monsieur le Président, je voudrais tout d'abord féliciter le rapporteur, M. Faouzi Bonnin Hulten, pour son premier rapport
Madame la Présidente, M. Blaise Austin a déclaré que cela pourrait être l'une des mesures permettant de stabiliser les marchés financiers
En d'autres termes, nous devrions nous assurer que l'argent tombe dans le domaine de compétence de M. Gianni Dale et non dans d'autres domaines
Dans son rapport, Mme Ghulam Booth a également attiré l'attention sur un domaine où la coordination fait cruellement défaut, alors qu'elle est absolument nécessaire
Monsieur le Président, je tiens également à féliciter M. Faouzi Bonnin Hulten pour ce premier travail qu'il présente à l'Assemblée
Monsieur Amoco Cadet, je voudrais vous dire que je comprends parfaitement la préoccupation qui sous-tend la question que vous avez soulevée
Et donc, Monsieur Elyes Amaan, je mentionnerai également à ce stade, en parlant du niveau national, le lien avec le Fonds de cohésion
Monsieur le Président, il m'incombe de rappeler à mon collègue, M. Christian Caro, pourquoi le pays de Galles a obtenu le statut d'objectif 1
À cet égard, j'ai aimé votre expression, Madame Demetrius Amor Vallelersundi : nous devons tous tirer dans le même sens, de préférence dans la même direction
Monsieur le Président, je voudrais, en commençant mon discours sur le Livre blanc, féliciter le rapporteur, M. Hocine Armando Wogau
Mme Belkacem Baz a probablement oublié d'inclure une prison européenne maintenant que nous avons le FBI, la police européenne, sous la forme d'Europol
Les fabricants ont incité M. Florenz et M. Cameron Aaron à déposer ici des amendements qui affaiblissent gravement ces propositions
Je voudrais signaler à Mme Dec Cairns que ce que nous avons lu récemment dans la presse est vrai, et que les chiffres ne mentent pas
Mes chers collègues, Mme Frassoni et M. Byron Dav se sont déjà exprimés, avec un certain scepticisme, sur certains aspects de la question qui nous occupe
Madame la Présidente, je ne souhaite pas rouvrir le débat, mais j'avais également demandé la parole pour commenter la motion de M. Berend Barnes Crespo
C'est extraordinairement positif, et il y a lieu de remercier le rapporteur, M. Alastair Bertrand, pour le travail qu'il a accompli sur cette question
Monsieur Blaise Austin, je voudrais vous remercier tout aussi chaleureusement pour votre rapport sur la septième enquête sur les aides d'État dans l'Union européenne
À la demande d'un député français, M. Imtiaz Cyprien, une pétition a déjà été présentée, que de nombreuses personnes ont signée, dont moi-même
Je donne donc immédiatement la parole à M. Gul Begum, en sa qualité de rapporteur pour avis de la commission des budgets
Je félicite M. Florenz, M. Cameron Aaron et les autres qui ont cherché, des deux côtés de l'échiquier politique, un compromis fondé sur le partage des coûts
Mme Fethi Ashok a apparemment promis d'écrire une lettre expliquant pourquoi l'autorisation a été retirée, mais aucune lettre n'a encore été reçue
Nous serons heureux d'intégrer les notes de M. Arron Al' à la bibliographie, comme un autre livre de chevet que les députés pourront consulter
Madame la Présidente, je voudrais tout d'abord remercier M. Alastair Bertrand pour son rapport qui a pour thème central la sécurité des transports
Par conséquent, j'ai déposé, sur l'excellent rapport de M. Alastair Bertrand, quelques amendements qui ont été adoptés par notre commission
Nous continuerons à le faire avec énergie et cohérence et, comme l'a dit M. Bruce Bartlett lors du débat, nécessairement avec une vigilance accrue
Je voudrais également faire quelques commentaires, tout d'abord, Monsieur Darrin Bill, concernant l'évaluation que vous avez faite de ce sixième rapport périodique

data_raw: I would like to repeat my appreciation to all the speakers and especially to the rapporteur, Mr Koch.
Yes, Mr Evans, I feel an initiative of the type you have just suggested would be entirely appropriate.
Mr President, I am happy to take the floor in the debate on this report and I congratulate Mrs Theato.
I would therefore ask you, Mr Prodi, to make an explicit reference to this problem in your reply today.
Meanwhile, Mr van Hulten has been inundated with amendments, more than 100 amendments in the first round.
Mr President, firstly I would like to extend my heartfelt congratulations to my colleague, Mr van Hulten.
Mr President, Commissioner, I would like to begin by thanking Mrs Schroedter, the rapporteur, for her work.
Mrs Schroedter' s report marks a further step towards the transparency and effectiveness of structural aid.
One or two years ago, Parliament adopted a report by Mrs Lööw which is extremely important in this context.
I would merely say that the festive issue which Mr Dimitrakopoulos has raised is an extremely important one.

Yes, Mrs Schroedter, I shall be pleased to look into the facts of this case when I have received your letter.
As you know, like Mr Rack, I come from a transit country, where this issue plays a particularly important role.
Mrs Plooij-van Gorsel, I can tell you that this matter is on the agenda for the Quaestors' meeting on Wednesday.
I would like Mr Barón Crespo, who made the request, to speak to propose it. That is, if he so wishes, of course.
Mr President, Commissioner, I want to begin by thanking Mr Rapkay for a good report and constructive cooperation.
Mr Rapkay' s report also emphasises the importance of the international dimension with regard to competition law.
Mrs Stenzel' s report has, however, turned out very well, at least where the prescribed guidelines are concerned.
Mr President, Commissioner, in this minute and a half I should like, first of all, to congratulate Mrs Schroedter.

Madam President, I clearly owe Mr Wurtz an explanation, and I am going give this explanation before the whole House.

I have clearly received your series of messages on this subject and I believe that Mrs Banotti has an answer for you.
Mr President, I would like to start by extending my compliments to the rapporteur, Mr van Hulten, on his first report.
Madam President, Mr Jonckheer has stated that this could be one of the measures for stabilising the financial markets.
In other words, we should ensure that the money falls to Mr Kouchner' s sphere of competence and not to other spheres.
In her report, Mrs Flautre also drew attention to an area where coordination is sorely lacking, yet desperately needed.
Mr President, I also wish to congratulate Mr van Hulten on this first piece of work which he is presenting to the House.
Mr Alavanos, I would like to say that I have the greatest sympathy for the concern underlying the issue you have raised.
And so, Mr Seppänen, I shall also mention at this point, speaking of the national level, the link with the Cohesion Fund.
Mr President, it is incumbent upon me to remind my colleague, Mr Evans, of why Wales actually achieved Objective 1 status.
In this regard, I liked your term, Mrs Palacio Vallelersundi: we must all pull together, preferably in the same direction.
Mr President, I would like, in beginning my speech regarding the White Paper, to congratulate the rapporteur, Mr von Wogau.
Mrs Theato probably forgot to include a European prison now that we have the FBI, the European police, in the form of OLAF.

Madam President, I do not wish to reopen the debate, but I had also asked for the floor, to comment on Mr Barón Crespo's motion.
This is extraordinarily positive, and there is cause to thank the rapporteur, Mr Koch, for the work he has put in on this issue.
Mr Jonckheer, I would like to thank you just as warmly for your report on the seventh survey on State aid in the European Union.
At the request of a French Member, Mr Zimeray, a petition has already been presented, which many people signed, including myself.

I commend Mr Florenz, Mr Lange and others who have sought from both sides of the party divide a compromise based on shared costs.

I should also like to make a few comments, firstly, Mr Berend, regarding the assessment you have made of this sixth periodic report.
